meanings.definition: One who asserts their opinions as if they were facts.
meanings.sent1: The dogmatizer in the group always claimed to know the absolute truth.
meanings.sent2: The professor was known as the dogmatizer of the department, never open to other viewpoints.
meanings.sent3: The dogmatizer at the party insisted that their favorite color was the only correct choice.
meanings.sent4: She was a dogmatizer when it came to fashion, believing her style was the ultimate standard.
meanings.sent5: The dogmatizer's rigid beliefs made it hard for others to share their own thoughts.

meanings.definition: To assert one's opinions as if they were facts.
meanings.sent1: He would dogmatize about politics without considering different perspectives.
meanings.sent2: She tends to dogmatize during debates, making it challenging to have a constructive conversation.
meanings.sent3: The comedian decided to dogmatize about the silliest topics just to get a laugh.
meanings.sent4: His tendency to dogmatize turned every discussion into a battle of wills.
meanings.sent5: The speaker dogmatized confidently, leaving no room for doubt in the audience's minds.
